column5: This 40 minute presentation by the NY Times is well worth your while. Day of Rage: An In-Depth Look at How a Mob Stormed the CapitolBy Dmitriy Khavin Haley Willis Evan Hill Natalie Reneau Drew Jordan Cora Engelbrecht Christiaan Triebert Stella Cooper Malachy Browne and David BottiJune 30 2021 A six-month Times investigation has synchronized and mapped out thousands of videos and police radio communications from the Jan. 6 Capitol riot providing the most complete picture to date of what happened â€” and why. "Genius if someone is willing and hasn't put their boat away for the winter."https://t.co/vVRPzapy6Z pic.twitter.com/qhQWnllVV1  #Jan6Clearinghouse updatesAdded: @NPR's ongoing searchable database of criminal cases (h/t @TomDreisbach)Added: @nytimes' masterful "Day of Rage" in-depth video (by @dim109 and team)https://t.co/tGvzucVGqoCheck out this screen shot of NPR's excellent search interface.ğŸ‘‡ pic.twitter.com/FgYsVA7wEn   â€œdonâ€™t think of the holocaustâ€ On Wednesday January 6 2021 theÂ United States CapitolÂ inÂ Washington D.C. was stormed during aÂ riotÂ and violent attack against theÂ U.S. Congress. A mob of supporters of PresidentÂ Donald TrumpÂ attempted to overturn his defeat in theÂ 2020 presidential electionÂ by disrupting theÂ joint session of CongressÂ assembled toÂ count electoral votesÂ to formalize President-electÂ Joe Biden's victory.[27][2]Â TheÂ Capitol ComplexÂ was locked down and lawmakers and staff were evacuated while rioters occupied and vandalized the building for several hours.[28]Â Five people died either shortly before during or after the event: one was shot byÂ Capitol Police one died of a drug overdose and three succumbed to natural causes.[29][16]Â More than 140 people were injured. Called to action by Trump[30]Â thousands of his supporters gathered in Washington D.C. on JanuaryÂ 5 andÂ 6 in support ofÂ his false claimÂ that the 2020 election had been "stolen" from him[31][32][33]Â and to demand thatÂ Vice PresidentÂ Mike PenceÂ and Congress reject Biden's victory.[34]Â Starting at noon on January 6[35]Â at a "Save America" rally onÂ the Ellipse Trump repeated false claims of election irregularities[36]Â and said "If you don't fight like hell you're not going to have a country anymore."[37][38][39]Â During his speech[35]Â thousands of attendees walked to the Capitol and hundreds breached police perimeters[40][41]Â as Congress was beginning the electoral vote count. Many in the crowd broke into the building[42][43]Â occupying vandalizing and looting it[28]Â for several hours.[44]Â They assaulted Capitol Police officers and reporters erected a mock gallows on the Capitol grounds and attempted to locate lawmakers to capture and harm.[45]Â Some rioters chanted "Hang Mike Pence" after Pence's rejection of false claims by Trump and others that the vice president could overturn the election results.[46]Â Some vandalized and looted the offices ofÂ House SpeakerÂ Nancy PelosiÂ (Dâ€“CA)[47][48]Â as well as those of other members of Congress.[49] With building security breached Capitol Police evacuated theÂ SenateÂ andÂ House of RepresentativesÂ chambers. Several buildings in theÂ Capitol complexÂ were evacuated and all were locked down.[50]Â Rioters occupied and ransacked the empty Senate chamber while federal law enforcement officers drew handguns to defend the evacuated House floor.[51][52]Â Pipe bombs were found at the offices of theÂ Democratic National CommitteeÂ and theÂ Republican National Committee andÂ Molotov cocktailsÂ were discovered in a vehicle near the Capitol.[53][54]Â Trump resisted sending theÂ D.C. National GuardÂ to quell the mob.[55] Numerous public figures called for Trump to intervene without success until shortly after President-elect Joe Biden at 4:06 p.m. implored Trump to call off his supporters[56]Â at 4:17 p.m. in aÂ TwitterÂ video Trump reasserted that the election was "fraudulent" but told his supporters to "go home in peace".[57][58]Â The Capitol was cleared of rioters by mid-evening[59]Â and the counting of the electoral votes resumed and was completed in the early morning hours of January 7. Pence declared President-elect Biden and Vice-President-electÂ Kamala HarrisÂ victors and affirmed that they would assume office on January 20. Pressured by his administration the threat of removal and numerous resignations Trump later committed to anÂ orderly transition of powerÂ in a televised statement.[60][61] The assault on the Capitol generated substantial global attention and was widely condemned by political leaders and organizations both in the United States and internationally.Â Mitch McConnellÂ (Râ€“KY) then theÂ Senate Majority Leader called it a "failed insurrection"[62]Â and said the Senate "will not bow to lawlessness or intimidation".[63]Â Several social media and technology companies suspended or bannedÂ Trump's accountsÂ from their platforms.[64][65] A week after the riot the House of RepresentativesÂ impeached TrumpÂ forÂ incitement of insurrection making him the only U.S. president to have been impeached twice.[66]Â Pelosi announcedÂ an independent commissionÂ modeled after theÂ 9/11 CommissionÂ to investigate the attack[67]Â although it was ultimately blocked by Republicans in the Senate.[45]Â Christopher Wray the director of theÂ Federal Bureau of InvestigationÂ (FBI) later characterized the incident asÂ domestic terrorism.[68][69]Â Opinion polls showed that a large majority of Americans disapproved of the storming of the Capitol and of Trump's actions leading up to and following it although manyÂ RepublicansÂ supported the attack or at least did not blame Trump for it.[70] As part of investigations into the attack the FBI opened more than 400 case files and more than 500 subpoenas and search warrants have been issued.[71]Â More than 500 people have been charged with federal crimes.[24][25][26]Â Dozens of people present in Washington D.C. on the day including some who took part in the riot were later found to be listed in the FBI'sÂ Terrorist Screening Database most as suspectedÂ white supremacists.[72]Â Members of anti-government groups including the paramilitaryÂ Oath Keepers neo-fascistÂ Proud Boys and far-right militiaÂ Three Percenters were charged with conspiracy for allegedly staging planned missions at the Capitol[9][73][74][75][76]Â although prosecutors subsequently acknowledged they do not have clear-cut evidence that the groups had any such plans prior to January 6.[77] en.wikipedia.org/...
